intro: Lachnaea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered lachnaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Lachnaea micrantha is often found in temperate climates and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role.
